It's optional to include it but if you do, you will get these features "for free":

drawer-webcomponent.DrawerWebcomponent.name: DrawerWebcomponent

2. Support all sides (top, right, bottom and left)
3. Support 3 animation types (push, slide and reveal)

sugar.js.class.toPlainObject.description: This function take a instance as parameter and return a plain object of it

sugar.js.cli.argsToObject.name: argsToObject
sugar.js.cli.argsToObject.description:
This function take a simple object, a definition object and return you the string version that you can pass

sugar.js.cli.argsToString.name: argsToString

This function take a simple object, a definition object and return you the string version that you can pass

sugar.js.cli.buildCommandLine.name: buildCommandLine
sugar.js.cli.buildCommandLine.description:
This function takes as parameters a command line (with tokens), an arguments object and a definition object to
generate the final command line string to launch.
A token is simply a string that begin with "[" and end with "]" like so: "[mytoken]".
Each arguments of the definition object can be a token. If you have an argument called "hostname", the corresponding token will be "[hostname]".
A special token called "[arguments]" is needed if you want the passed arguments to be integrated to the builded command line.

sugar.js.cli.completeArgsObject.name: completeArgsObject
sugar.js.cli.completeArgsObject.description:
This function take an arguments object and complete it with the definition object default values

sugar.js.cli.parseArgs.name: parseArgs
sugar.js.cli.parseArgs.description: Parse a string to find the provided arguments into the list and return a corresponding object.

sugar.js.code.SCodeSplitter.name: SCodeSplitter
sugar.js.code.SCodeSplitter.description:
This class allows you to specify some "splitters" that will be used to split the code accordingly.
A "splitter" is an object of these properties:
- type (null) {String}: A simple word used as "type" to define the splitted blocks
- prefix (null) {Regex}: A regex used to detect the start of a block
- suffix (null) {Regex}: A regex used to detect what can be after the block
- open ('{') {String}: A 1 character string that specify the opening of a code block like "{", etc...
- close ('}') {String}: A 1 character string that specify the closing of a code block like "}", etc...
- exclude (null) {Array<Regex>}: An array of regex used to exclude some previously matched blocks of this splitter

split.name: split
split.description:
This method is the main one that allows you to actually split the passed code
into small pieces.

sugar.js.color.color.description: Simple wrapper to create an SColor instance quickly

sugar.js.color.convert.name: convert
sugar.js.color.convert.description:
This function take as input any color format like rgba Object, hsl Object, hsv Object, hex String, rgba String, hsl String or hsv String
and convert it into the wanted format like "rgba", "hsl", "hsv", "hex", "rgbaString", "hslString" or "hsvString"

sugar.js.color.parseRgba.name: parseRgba

sugar.js.color.SColor.name: SColor
sugar.js.color.SColor.description:
Class that provide complete and simple to use color manupilation capabilities like:
- Modifiers
- opacity
- darken
- lighten
- desaturate
- saturate
- spin (change hue)
- transparentize
- alpha
- grayscale

- rgba
- hsl
- hsv
- hex

- toHslString
- toHsvString
- toHexString
- toString(format = null)

getColor.name: getColor
getColor.description:
This method take as parameter the passed color to the constructor and has to return the
actual real color like color from the static colors listed in the SColor class or maybe
from the Sugar configured colors

v.name: v

grayscale.name: grayscale

spin.name: spin
spin.description: Spin the hue on the passed value (max 360)

sugar.js.config.config.name: config

This class allows you to quickly access/update some configuration depending on the data adapters specified.
The base available data adapters are:

load.name: load
load.description: Load the config from the default adapter or from the passed adapter

save.name: save
save.description: Save the config through all the registered adapters or just the one specify in params

get.name: get
get.description: Get a config depending on the dotted object path passed and either using the first registered adapter found, or the passed one

sugar.js.core.activeSpace.name: activeSpace
sugar.js.core.activeSpace.description:
This object expose some functions that are usefull to manage the "active" space of your application.
An active space is represented by a string formated like so "something.cool.hello". This mean that your app is
in the "something.cool.hello" space and depending on that, you can enable or disable some features like for example
keypress that have to be active only in certain "space" of your application.
The exposed functions are these ones:
- set: This allows you to set the active space
- get: This allows you to get the current active space
- is: This allows you to check if the passed active space string is in the current active space
- previous: This allows you to go back 1 activeSpace in the stack
- on: This allows you to register callbacks attached to an activeSpace
- append: This allows you to append an activeSpace string to the current one

get.name: get
get.description: This function allows you to get the current active space

set.name: set
set.description: This function allows you to set the current active space

append.name: append
append.description: This function take the current activeSpace string and add the passed one to set the new activeSpace string

remove.name: remove
remove.description: This function simply remove the passed string from the activeSpace stack

previous.name: previous
previous.description: This function simply go back by 1 in the activeSpace stack

is.name: is
is.description:
This function allows you to check if the active space string that you pass match with the current active space or not.
The checking process is done using the "minimatch" package that let you use cool features like "", "**", etc...

on.name: on
on.description:
This function allows you to register a callback linked with an activeSpace string
that will be called once the activeSpace is matched

sugar.js.descriptor.SDescriptor.name: SDescriptor
sugar.js.descriptor.SDescriptor.description:
This class is the main one that MUST be used as parent one
when creating any descriptor like object, string, etc...

rules.name: rules
rules.description: Store the registered rules into a simple object

type.name: type
type.description:
Specify the type of the values that this descriptor is made for.
Can be:

settings.name: settings
settings.description: Store the default settings for this particular descriptor class

registerRule.name: registerRule
registerRule.description:
This static method allows you to register a new rule
by passing a valid ISDescriptorRule object

name.name: name
name.description: Access the descriptor name. Either the value of settings.name, or the constructor name

id.name: id
id.description: Access the descriptor id. Either the value of settings.name, or the constructor name

apply.name: apply
apply.description:
This method simply apply the descriptor instance on the passed value.
The value can be anything depending on the descriptor you use.
When you pass an Array, by default it will apply the descriptor on
each array items. If you don't want this behavior and the Array passed has to be
treated as a single value, pass the "arrayAsValue" setting to true

toConsole.name: toConsole

sugar.js.dom.when.name: when
sugar.js.dom.when.description:
Return a promise that will be resolved when the wanted status has been applied on the passed HTMLElement.
The status that can be requested are:
- attribute : Detect when a special attribute has been applied on the element
--- settings.attribute : Specify the attribute to check
--- settings.checkFn : An optional function to check the attribute. The promise is resolved when this function return true

- inViewport : Detect when the element enter in the viewport
--- settings.offset : Specify an offset to detect the in viewport state

- outOfViewport : Detect when the element exit the viewport
--- settings.offset : Specify an offset to detect the out viewport state

- transitionEnd : Detect when the css transition is finished on the element
--- settings.callback : An optional callback function if you prefer instead of the promise

- visible : Detect when the element become visible
--- settings.callback : An optional callback function if you prefer instead of the promise

sugar.js.dom.whenOutOfViewport.description: Monitor an HTMLElement to be notified when it exit the viewport

sugar.js.dom.whenTransitionEnd.name: whenTransitionEnd

Proxy class to create custom events that can be dispatched

settings.cancelable.description: Set if the event is cancelable or not

settings.bubbles.name: settings.bubbles
settings.bubbles.description: Set if the event will bubble or not

settings.detail.name: settings.detail
settings.detail.description: Pass an object that will be sent with the event

pipe.name: pipe
pipe.description:
This method is the same as the ```pipe```and ```pipeFrom``` one but it's just act as the inverse.
Here you specify whenre you want to pipe this instance events and not from which you want to pipe them here...

pipeFrom.name: pipeFrom
pipeFrom.description: This is the exacte same as the original ```pipe``` method. It's just an aliasw.

emit.name: emit
emit.description: This is the method that allows you to emit the callbacks like "catch", "finally", etc... without actually resolving the Promise itself

on.name: on
on.description:
This method allows the SEventEmitter user to register a function that will be called every time the "resolve" one is called in the executor
The context of the callback will be the SEventEmitter instance itself so you can call all the methods available like "resolve", "release", "on", etc using
the "this.resolve('something')" statusment. In an arrow function like "(value) => { ... }", the "this" keyword will be bound to the current context where you define
your function. You can access to the SEventEmitter instance through the last parameter like so "(value, SEventEmitterInstance) => { ... }".

off.name: off
off.description:
This method allows you to unsubscribe to an event by passing the event name an optionally the callback function.
If you don't pass the callback function, all the subscribed events the same as the passed one will be unsubscribed.

sugar.js.http.SRequest.name: SRequest
sugar.js.http.SRequest.description:
Class that allows to simply handle ajax requests with ease.
This class give some useful features like :
- Promise support
- Recursive requests

retry.name: retry
retry.description: Reset the request settings variables and relaunch the request

send.name: send
send.description:
Send the request and return a promise that will be resolved once all the requests
have been made or rejected if one of the requests has returned an error...

sugar.js.http.SRequestConfig.name: SRequestConfig
sugar.js.http.SRequestConfig.description:
Class that represent an ajax request that will be passed to an SRequest instance.
All the axios settings are supported by this class

baseURL.name: baseURL
baseURL.description:
Specify the base url to call like "https://api.github.com/2.0" for example.
If the "url" setting is absolute, this setting will don't have any impact on your request...

method.name: method
method.description: The request method to use like GET, POST, DELETE or PUT

headers.name: headers
headers.description: Specify some headers to add to the request

params.name: params
params.description:
Specify some params to be sent through the URL.
Must be a plain object or a URLSearchParams object

data.name: data
data.description:
Specify some data you want to send with the request.
This setting is available only for 'PUT', 'POST', and 'PATCH' requests...

timeout.name: timeout
timeout.description:
Specify time to wait before aborting the actual request. If setted in number format, this will mean milliseconds.
You can also specify this settings using string format like so: '2s', '1h', '4m', etc...

sendInterval.name: sendInterval
sendInterval.description:
Set the interval time between each requests if the sendCount setting is specified.
If setted in number format, this is taken as millisenconds. You can also set the interval
in string format like '34s', '1h', '10ms', '2d', etc...

sendCount.name: sendCount
sendCount.description: Set how many times the request has to be sent

everyResponse.name: everyResponse
everyResponse.description:
Specify a function to call on every response. The parameters passed to the function are:
- response {Object}: The actual request response
- requestIdx {Number}: The request index

responseType.name: responseType
responseType.description: Indicates the type of data that the server will respond with

sugar.js.interface.SInterface.name: SInterface

This class allows you to define some rules that some object or instance
have to follow. You will be able to apply these rules and see what
does not fit correctly.

definition.name: definition
definition.description:
This property store all the SDescriptor rules that this interface
implements for each properties

overrie.name: overrie
overrie.description:
This static method is usefull to make a duplicate of the base interface with some updates
in the definition object.

getAvailableTypes.name: getAvailableTypes
getAvailableTypes.description:
This static method allows you to get the types that have been make widely available
using the ```makeAvailableAsType``` method.

makeAvailableAsType.name: makeAvailableAsType
makeAvailableAsType.description:
This static method allows you to promote your interface at the level where it can be
used in the "type" interface definition property like so "Object<MyCoolType>"

settings.name: settings
settings.description:
This property store all the settings for your SInterface class. These settings
can be overrided at instance level

defaults.name: defaults
defaults.description: This function simply returns you the default interface values in object format

apply.name: apply
apply.description:
This method allows you to apply the interface on an object instance.
By default, if something is wrong in your class implementation, an error with the
description of what's wrong will be thrown. You can change that behavior if you prefer having
true returned when all is ok, or a string describing the current issue by specify the "settings.throw" property to false.

sugar.js.interface.SInterfaceResult.name: SInterfaceResult
sugar.js.interface.SInterfaceResult.description:

You will be able to generate some string terminal version of the return as well as some html
version if needed

hasIssues.name: hasIssues

toString.name: toString
toString.description: This method return a string terminal compatible or html of this result object

toConsole.name: toConsole
toConsole.description:
This method simply returns you a terminal compatible string
of the interface checking result

This function allows you to add Proxy to an object in deep fashion.
Normally the Proxy process only the level on which it has been added. Here we add Proxy to all the
object levels and to new properties as well.

On the returned proxied object, you will have access to the ```revoke``` method that you can call to revoke the proxy applied.
This method will return you a shallow version of the proxied object that you can use as you want

sugar.js.promise.SPromise.name: SPromise
sugar.js.promise.SPromise.description:
This class works the same as the default Promise one. The difference is that you have more control on this one like
the possibility to resolve it multiple times. Here's a list of the "differences" and the "features" that this class provide:

treatAsValue.name: treatAsValue
treatAsValue.description:
This method wrap the promise into a revocable proxy to allow
passing this Promise to methods like ```then```, etc... and make
this promise treated as a value and not as a chained promise.
Once you have done with this behavior, you just have to call
the ```restorePromiseBehavior``` on the returned proxy and
the default promise behavior will be restored

promiseState.name: promiseState
promiseState.description:
Access the promise state. Can be one of these:
- pending: When the promise is waiting for resolution or rejection
- resolved: When the promise has been resolved
- rejected: When the promise has been rejected
- canceled: When the promise has been canceled
- destroyed: When the promise has been destroyed

is.name: is
is.description: Check is the promise is on one of the passed status

isPending.name: isPending
isPending.description: Return back true or false depending on the promise status

isResolved.name: isResolved
isResolved.description: Return back true or false depending on the promise status

isRejected.name: isRejected
isRejected.description: Return back true or false depending on the promise status

isCanceled.name: isCanceled
isCanceled.description: Return back true or false depending on the promise status

isDestroyed.name: isDestroyed
isDestroyed.description: Return back true or false depending on the promise status

resolve.name: resolve
resolve.description: This is the "resolve" method exposed on the promise itself for convinience

reject.name: reject
reject.description: This is the "reject" method exposed on the promise itself for convinience

cancel.name: cancel
cancel.description: This is the "cancel" method exposed on the promise itself for convinience

catch.name: catch
catch.description:
This method allows the SPromise user to register a function that will be called every time the "reject" one is called in the executor
The context of the callback will be the SPromise instance itself so you can call all the methods available like "resolve", "catch", etc using
the "this.resolve('something')" statusment. In an arrow function like "(value) => { ... }", the "this" keyword will be bound to the current context where you define
your function. You can access to the SPromise instance through the last parameter like so "(value, sPromiseInstance) => { ... }".

finally.name: finally
finally.description:
This method allows the SPromise user to register a function that will be called every time the "reject" one is called in the executor
The context of the callback will be the SPromise instance itself so you can call all the methods available like "resolve", "catch", etc using
the "this.resolve('something')" statusment. In an arrow function like "(value) => { ... }", the "this" keyword will be bound to the current context where you define
your function. You can access to the SPromise instance through the last parameter like so "(value, sPromiseInstance) => { ... }".

resolved.name: resolved
resolved.description:
This method allows the SPromise user to register a function that will be called every time the "reject" one is called in the executor
The context of the callback will be the SPromise instance itself so you can call all the methods available like "resolve", "catch", etc using
the "this.resolve('something')" statusment. In an arrow function like "(value) => { ... }", the "this" keyword will be bound to the current context where you define
your function. You can access to the SPromise instance through the last parameter like so "(value, sPromiseInstance) => { ... }".

rejected.name: rejected
rejected.description:
This method allows the SPromise user to register a function that will be called every time the "reject" one is called in the executor
The context of the callback will be the SPromise instance itself so you can call all the methods available like "resolve", "catch", etc using
the "this.resolve('something')" statusment. In an arrow function like "(value) => { ... }", the "this" keyword will be bound to the current context where you define
your function. You can access to the SPromise instance through the last parameter like so "(value, sPromiseInstance) => { ... }".

canceled.name: canceled
canceled.description:
This method allows the SPromise user to register a function that will be called once when the "revoke" function has been called
The context of the callback will be the SPromise instance itself so you can call all the methods available like "resolve", "catch", etc using
the "this.resolve('something')" statusment. In an arrow function like "(value) => { ... }", the "this" keyword will be bound to the current context where you define
your function. You can access to the SPromise instance through the last parameter like so "(value, sPromiseInstance) => { ... }".

sugar.js.promise.treatAsValue.name: treatAsValue
sugar.js.promise.treatAsValue.description:
This function allows you to wrap a promise in a ```resolve``` call to prevent
this promise to be treated as a "chaining" promise but to be treated as
normal value passed in the resolve call.

sugar.js.responsive.SMediaQuery.name: SMediaQuery
sugar.js.responsive.SMediaQuery.description:
This class expose some nice and easy methods to get the active media query defined in the config.media.queries configuration
stack, as well as register to some events list "match" or "unmatch".

startListener.name: startListener
startListener.description: Add the global listener based on the "init-body-media-queries" scss mixin

sugar.js.stream.SActionStream.name: SActionStream
sugar.js.stream.SActionStream.description:
This class represent the base of a actions stream.
An action stream if simply some functions that are called one after the other
and that pass to each other some value(s) on which to work.
Here's all the "events" that you can subscribe on the SActionStream instance, or on the returned SPromise when calling the "start" method:
- start: emited when the overall actions stream starts
- {actionName}.start: emited when the specified action starts
- {actionName}.reject: emited when the specified action has been rejected
- {actionName}.complete: emited when the specified action has been completed
- complete: emited when the overall actions stream has been completed
- resolve: Trigerred when the overall actions stream has been completed
- log: emited when a log message has been set
- cancel: emited when the stream has been canceled using the "cancel" method of the returned SPromise when calling the "start" method

hasCurrentStreamErrors.name: hasCurrentStreamErrors
hasCurrentStreamErrors.description: This method return true or false depending if the current stream has some errors or not

start.name: start
start.description: This method launch the action stream and return an SPromise instance for this particular stream "process"

log.name: log
log.description: THis method allows you to log something that will be passed upward through the SPromise events "stdout".

sugar.js.stream.SActionStreamAction.name: SActionStreamAction
sugar.js.stream.SActionStreamAction.description:
This class represent the base of a actions stream action.
An action stream action represent an action that you can register in the SActionsStream instance and
prodive you some usefull features like "emit" some events, set/get data from the streamObj, defining some required streamObj properties
to work with, etc...

checkStreamObject.name: checkStreamObject
checkStreamObject.description:
This method take the streamObj object passed to the "run" method and check it depending on the definition
specified in the static definition property.

skipNextActions.name: skipNextActions
skipNextActions.description:
This method allows you to tell the SActionStream class that you want to skip
the next actions. If you don't specify anything, it means that you want to skip
ALL the next actions. You can pass a number that mean that you want to skip x next action(s),
or an array with the actions names that you want to skip.

registerCallback.name: registerCallback
registerCallback.description:
This method allows you to register some callbacks during the stream action process.
You can specify when you want to register this callback like "before" or "after", and specify if
it's before/after the entire stream process or a particular action.

run.name: run
run.description:
This method is the one that has to be overrided.
It will be called to run the actions on want on the streamObj passed as parameter
and MUST return a Promise instance that you need to resolve at the end of your processed
and pass it the updated streamObject.

error.name: error
error.description: This method allows you to error a message that will be catched by the parent manager class

warn.name: warn
warn.description: This method allows you to warn a message that will be catched by the parent manager class

log.name: log
log.description: This method allows you to log a message that will be catched by the parent manager class

This class represent a duration tracking process. Simply instanciate it,
then call the ```instance.get()``` method and you will get back

sugar.js.time.STimer.name: STimer
sugar.js.time.STimer.description:
Class that let you create and handle timer with ease.
With this class you can set some callback function that will be
called each x ms or tell that you want your callbacks to be called
a certain number of time during the timer time.
This class extends the SPromise one, meaning that you can subscribe to differents "events" emited by the timer instance. Here's the list:
- complete: emited when the timer is completed
- tick: emited at each ticks depending on your settings
- duration: emited when the duration has been changed
- tickCount: emited when the tickCount has been changed
- reset: emited when the timer has been reseted
- start: emited when the timer starts
- pause: emited when the timer has been paused
- stop: emited when the timer has been stoped
- destroy: emited when the timer has been destroyed

remaing.name: remaing
remaing.description: Get the remaining time in ms

duration.name: duration
duration.description: Set or get the duration. Can be a number in milliseconds, or a time string like '1m', '2s', etc...

percentage.name: percentage
percentage.description: Get the current timer advancement percentage

isStarted.name: isStarted
isStarted.description: Check if the timer is started

sugar.js.time.wait.name: wait
sugar.js.time.wait.description: This function is a simple "setTimeout" wrapper inside a promise.

sugar.js.url.parseSchema.name: parseSchema
sugar.js.url.parseSchema.description:
This function take two arguments. The first one is the url to parse and the second is a schema to scan the url with.
The schema describe the pathname of an url and tell's how to analyze it.
Here's a little description with some example of schemas:
- "{param1}/{param2}/{param3}": This schema describe that your Url must have 3 "values" named param1, param2 and param3
- If my Url is "something.com/hello/world/plop", my schema is respected and I can have access to the values through the "schema.params.param1", "schema.params.param2", etc...
- "{hello:string}/{world:number}/{?idx:number}": This schema describe that the Url can have 3 "values" but the last one is optional
- If my Url is "something.com/plop/3/1", my schema is respected
- If my Url is "something.com/plop/2", my schema is respected
- If my Url is "something.com/plop/hello/2", my schema is not respected due to the fact that the param named "world" has to be a number

sugar.js.url.queryStringToObject.name: queryStringToObject
sugar.js.url.queryStringToObject.description: Transform a query string into his object (key => pairs) representation

sugar.js.url.SUrl.name: SUrl
sugar.js.url.SUrl.description:
Simple class that is useful to parse a URL (or the current browser URL) and gives you back
an instance that has all these values availables as well as functions to modify the instancied URL:
- protocol: The protocol scheme of the URL (e.g. http:).
- slashes: A boolean which indicates whether the protocol is followed by two forward slashes (//).
- auth: Authentication information portion (e.g. username:password).
- username: Username of basic authentication.
- password: Password of basic authentication.
- host: Host name with port number.
- hostname: Host name without port number.
- port: Optional port number.
- pathname: URL path.
- query: Parsed object containing query string
- queryString: Origin query string from the URL
- hash: The "fragment" portion of the URL including the pound-sign (#).
- href: The full URL.
- origin: The origin of the URL.
- schema: The schema property gives you access to an object containing these properties (only if you have provided the settings.schema setting):
- match (true) {Boolean}: Tells you if your current url match the passed schema
- errors (null) {Object}: Gives you access to which param(s) is/are in error
- params (null) {Object}: Gives you access to each params specified in the schema with their values, etc...

This class use internally the `url-parse` npm module that you can find here: https://www.npmjs.com/package/url-parse

schema.name: schema
schema.description:
Access the schema parsing result if the settings.schema has been provided.
This object contain these properties:
- params ({}) {Object}: Store the path params found like /{client}/{name}
- errors ({}) {Object}: Store the parsing errors if has some
- match (true) {Boolean}: Store if the current url match with the provided schema

slashes.name: slashes
slashes.description: A boolean which indicates whether the protocol is followed by two forward slashes (//).

host.name: host
host.description: Get/set Host name with port number

hostname.name: hostname
hostname.description: Get/set host name without port number

queryString.name: queryString
queryString.description: Origin query string from the URL

hash.name: hash
hash.description: The "fragment" portion of the URL including the pound-sign (#)

toString.name: toString
toString.description: Return the full URL in string format

sugar.js.value.typeof.description:
This function return the correct type of the passed value.
It support the recognition of arrays and return 'Array' as property type.
You can olso ask the function to gives you the "of" types of the passed value. This mean that if you
pass an Array like so "[10,'Hello',true]" and that you ask for "of" types, it will returns you
"Array<Integer|String|Boolean>".
Another feature is to ask the result as an object like so:
{
type: 'Array',
of: ['Integer','String','Boolean']
}
You can ask also the typeof function to returns you the actual class name if the passed value is an instance
of an custom class.

sugar.js.webcomponent.SLitHtmlWebCompone.name: SLitHtmlWebComponent
sugar.js.webcomponent.SLitHtmlWebCompone.description:
// TODO: example

lit.name: lit
lit.description: Store all the litHtml functions that you may need

$root.name: $root
$root.description: Access the root element of the webcomponent from which the requests like ```$``` and ```$$``` will be executed

update.name: update
update.description:
This method allows you to update your componment manually if needed.
- call the ```render``` method of this class

render.name: render
render.description: This method is called every time an update has been made in the state object

sugar.js.webcomponent.SWebComponent.name: SWebComponent
sugar.js.webcomponent.SWebComponent.description:
// TODO: example

Base class that allows you to create easily new webcomponents and handle things like attributes updates,
base css (scss) importing, etc... Here's a list a features that this class covers:
- Listen for attributes changes
- Mount the component at a certain point in time (inViewport, visible, etc...)
- *Automatically cast the attributes** to their proper js variable types (Array, Object, String, etc...)
- *Physical props** : Specify some props that will ALWAYS be present as attribute on the component for styling purpose
- Define some *default CSS** that will be injected in the head automatically
- Specify some *required props**
- *Full lifecycle management** through "events":
- attach: Dispatched when the component is attached to the DOM
- detach: Dispatched when the component is detached from the DOM
- mounting: Dispatched when the component starts to mount itself (before mountWhen and mountDependencies execution)
- mounted: Dispatched when the component has be mounted properly
- prop|prop.{name}: Dispatched when a property has been updated, removed or added
- The object format sended with the event is this one:
- { prop: 'propName', action: 'update|remove|add', value: 'Something', previousValue: 'Other' }
- *Mount dependencies** : This will allows you to set some promises that have to be resolved before mounting the component

observedAttributes.name: observedAttributes
observedAttributes.description:
This medhod simply return the list of props that will be
observed by the customElements under the hood system.

componentName.name: componentName
componentName.description: Store the name of the component in camelcase

getComponentMetas.name: getComponentMetas
getComponentMetas.description:
This static method return the component metas information like:
- name: The camelcase component name
- dashName: The component name in dash case
- class: The component class
- extends: The HTML class that the component extends
- settings: An object of settings

define.name: define
define.description: This method allows you to define your component as a webcomponent recognized by the browser

$root.name: $root
$root.description: Access the root element of the webcomponent from which the requests like ```$``` and ```$$``` will be executed

update.name: update
update.description: This method allows you to update your component manually if needed

$.description: This method is a shortcut to the ```querySelector``` function

$$.description: This method is a shortcut to the ```querySelectorAll``` function

registerContext.name: registerContext
registerContext.description:
This method allows you to register some additional contexts that "this"
for the component to be able to find expressions like ```:on-select="doSometing"```
It is used by all the SWebComponent instances to find their parent components for example

setProp.name: setProp
setProp.description:
This method allows you to set a prop and specify the "media" for which you want to set this value
The media parameter can be one of the media queries defined in the configuration config.media.queries

getProp.name: getProp
getProp.description:
This method allows you to get a prop and specify the "media" for which you want to get this value
The media parameter can be one of the media queries defined in the configuration config.media.queries

setSettings.name: setSettings
setSettings.description: This method allows you to set some settings by merging the actual once with your new once

addClass.name: addClass
addClass.description:
This method can be used to add class(es) to an element in the component.
This will take care of adding the pcomponent name prefix as well as the ```cssName```prefix
if needed

removeClass.name: removeClass
removeClass.description:
This method can be used to remove class(es) to an element in the component.
This will take care of adding the component name prefix as well as the ```cssName```prefix
if needed

metas.name: metas
metas.description:
This property store all the component metas informations like the name,
the type, what it is extending, etc...

on.name: on
on.description:
Method used to subscribe to the "events" dispatched
during the lifecycle of the component. Here's the list of events:
- attach: Dispatched when the component is attached to the DOM
- detach: Dispatched when the component is detached from the DOM
- mounting: Dispatched when the component starts to mount itself (before mountWhen and mountDependencies execution)
- mounted: Dispatched when the component has be mounted properly
- prop|prop.{name}: Dispatched when a property has been updated, removed or added
- The object format sended with the event is this one:
- { prop: 'propName', action: 'update|remove|add', value: 'Something', previousValue: 'Other' }

off.name: off
off.description: Method used to unsubscribe to a previously subscribed event

connectedCallback.name: connectedCallback
connectedCallback.description: Called when the component is attached to the dom

disconnectedCallback.name: disconnectedCallback
disconnectedCallback.description: Called when the component is detached from the dom

attributeChangedCallback.name: attributeChangedCallback
attributeChangedCallback.description: Called when an attribute is removed, added or updated

selector.name: selector
selector.description:
This method return you a selector generated depending on the
webcomponent name

sugar.node.blessed.SBlessedComponent.name: SBlessedComponent
sugar.node.blessed.SBlessedComponent.description: This class is the base one for all the sugar blessed components like input, panel, etc...

getScreen.name: getScreen
getScreen.description: Get the screen initiated when using some SBlessedComponent instances

destroyScreen.name: destroyScreen
destroyScreen.description: Get the screen initiated when using some SBlessedComponent instances

screen.name: screen
screen.description: Store the global screen initiated by the first component

innerWidth.name: innerWidth
innerWidth.description:
Access the inner width of the component. This mean the actual width
minus the left/right padding

setFramerate.name: setFramerate
setFramerate.description:
This method allows you to simply change the interval timeout between the screen renders process.
Note that calling this will change the GLOBAL render screen interval so use with caution...

update.name: update
update.description: This method simply update the screen if the component is a child of one

isDisplayed.name: isDisplayed
isDisplayed.description: Check if the component is in the display list of the screen

isDestroyed.name: isDestroyed
isDestroyed.description: Check if the component (screen) has been destroyed

emit.name: emit
emit.description: emit some "events" through the SPromise instance

sugar.node.cache.SFileCache.name: SFileCache
sugar.node.cache.SFileCache.description:
This class can be used to cache some files.
It featured all the capabilities of the SCache class
but take as ```get``` and ```set``` name parameter, the actual absolute
file path to cache.

get.name: get
get.description: Get a value back from the cache using the specified adapter in the settings

set.name: set
set.description: Set a value to the cache system using the specified adapter with some settings like described bellow

sugar.node.cli.SCli.name: SCli
sugar.node.cli.SCli.description: This class represent a basic CLI command with his definition object, his command string, etc...

parseArgs.name: parseArgs
parseArgs.description:
This static method take a simple cli configuration string and returns you
an object representing each values passed.
This methods uses the static definition object of the class to do his job.

runningParamsObj.name: runningParamsObj
runningParamsObj.description: Get the current process lauched with "run" or "runWithOutput" methods arguments

run.name: run
run.description:
This method run a new child process with the provided arguments and the definition object.
The returned object MUST be an SPromise instance that emit these "events":
- start: emited when the command start a process
- close: emited when the process is closed
- kill: emited when the process has been killed
- success: emited when the process has finished without any error
- error: emited when the process has had an error
- log: emited when some data are pushed in the stdout channel

toString.name: toString
toString.description: This method allows you to pass an arguments object and return the builded command line string depending on the definition object.

isRunning.name: isRunning
isRunning.description: This method simply return true or false if the child process is running or not

kill.name: kill
kill.description: This method simply kill the running child process if their's one, otherwise it will do nothing.

sugar.node.clipboard.copy.name: copy
sugar.node.clipboard.copy.description:
Simple function to copy things into the system clipboard.
This is using https://www.npmjs.com/package/clipboardy under the hood.

sugar.node.clipboard.paste.name: paste
sugar.node.clipboard.paste.description:
Simple function to paste things from the system clipboard.
This is using https://www.npmjs.com/package/clipboardy under the hood.

sugar.node.color.color.name: color
sugar.node.color.color.description: Simple wrapper to create an SColor instance quickly

sugar.node.compiler.SCompiler.name: SCompiler
sugar.node.compiler.SCompiler.description:
This represent the main compiler class that has to be extended for compilers like typescript, scss, etc...
His main goal is to provide basic features like storing the inputs, settings, etc...

compile.name: compile
compile.description:
This method is the one you have to call when you want to launch a compilation process.
It will call the ```_compile``` one which MUST return an instance of the SPromise class.

sugar.node.config.sugar.name: sugar
sugar.node.config.sugar.description:
This function allows you to access easily the configurations stored in the ```sugar.config.js```.
The returned configuration is the result of the default sugar config stored in the toolkit and the
app defined config stored in current application root folder

sugar.node.css.classname.name: classname
sugar.node.css.classname.description: This function take a classname you want to generate and returns you the prefixed (if prefix exists in config.classes) classname

sugar.node.deamon.SDeamon.name: SDeamon
sugar.node.deamon.SDeamon.description: This class is the base one for all the "Deamons" classes like SFsDeamon, etc...

logs.name: logs
logs.description:
Store the different logs messages like:
- watching: Displayed when the deamon pass in watching mode
- paused: Displayed when the deamon pass in pause mode

on.name: on
on.description:
Override the ```on``` SPromise method to allow the use of the "update" shortcut.
When using the "update" shortcut, the registered events will actually be the one
specified in the ```settings.updateStacks```.

getUpdateLog.name: getUpdateLog
getUpdateLog.description:
This function is used to generate the update log string
depending on the updated file, data, etc...

processParams.name: processParams
processParams.description:
This method can be called to process the passed params object
using the function setted in the settings.processParams

watch.name: watch
watch.description:
This method take the extended watch method promise as parameter
to listen on it automatically for events like "close", etc...
It also pipe the events from the promise on the instance directly
to you can listen for event directly on the class instance itself

sugar.node.docblock.firstDocblockWithNam.name: firstDocblockWithNamespaceInFolder
sugar.node.docblock.firstDocblockWithNam.description:
This function search in the passed folder for files containing a "@namespace" tag (and an "@name" optional one)
and generate a SNav instance with all these founded files as sources...

sugar.node.build.docMap.SBuildDocMapProc.name: SBuildDocMapProcess
sugar.node.build.docMap.SBuildDocMapProc.description: This class represent the process that build the docMap.json file

process.name: process
process.description: Method that execute the actual process code

sugar.node.doc.SDocMap.name: SDocMap
sugar.node.doc.SDocMap.description:
This class represent the ```docMap.json``` file and allows you to build it from some sources (glob pattern(s))
and save it inside a directory you choose.

find.name: find
find.description:
This static method allows you to search for docMap.json files and get back the array of pathes where to
find the found files

read.name: read
read.description:
This static method allows you to search for docMap.json files and read them to get
back the content of them in one call. It can take advantage of the cache if
the setting.cache property is setted to true

build.name: build
build.description:
This method allows you to specify one or more glob patterns to scan files for "@namespace" docblock tags
and extract all the necessary informations to build the docMap.json file

save.name: save
save.description:
This method save the docMap.json file in the outputDir setted in the settings.
You can specify an output path as parameter to use this instead of the instance level settings.

sugar.node.error.handleError.name: handleError
sugar.node.error.handleError.description:
This function take a thrown error and try to display it the best way possible.
Simply add the "uncaughtException" and the "unhandledRejection" listeners on the process object,
pass this function as the handler one and that's it...

sugar.node.event.emit.name: emit
sugar.node.event.emit.description:
This function can ben used to emit an event globally.
You can subscribe to these events using the "sugar.node.event.subscribe" function

sugar.node.event.on.name: on
sugar.node.event.on.description:
This function allows you to subscribe to global events emited by the "sugar.node.event.dispatch" function
It use under the hood an SPromise instance

sugar.node.doc.SFrontspec.name: SFrontspec
sugar.node.doc.SFrontspec.description:
This class represent the ```frontspec.json``` file and allows you to generate it from some sources (glob pattern(s))
and save it inside a directory you choose.

search.description:
This method allows you to search for frontspec.json files and get back the array of pathes where to
find the found files

json.name: json
json.description:
Generate the frontspec JSON by searching for "childs" one as well as generating the "root" one
stored at the root of your package.

sugar.node.fs.downloadFile.name: downloadFile
sugar.node.fs.downloadFile.description: Download a file and save it on the file system

sugar.node.fs.ensureDir.name: ensureDir
sugar.node.fs.ensureDir.description: Ensure that the passed directory exists. If not, will be created recursively... (async)

sugar.node.fs.ensureDirSync.name: ensureDirSync
sugar.node.fs.ensureDirSync.description: Ensure that the passed directory exists. If not, will be created recursively... (sync)

sugar.node.fs.ensureFile.name: ensureFile
sugar.node.fs.ensureFile.description: Ensure that the passed file exists. If not, it will be created... (async)

sugar.node.fs.ensureFileSync.name: ensureFileSync
sugar.node.fs.ensureFileSync.description: Ensure that the passed file exists. If not, will be created... (async)

sugar.node.fs.extension.name: extension
sugar.node.fs.extension.description: Return the passed file path extension

sugar.node.fs.filename.name: filename
sugar.node.fs.filename.description: Return the filename from the passed path with or without the extension

sugar.node.fs.findUp.name: findUp
sugar.node.fs.findUp.description:
This function simply walk across upper folders to search for a file
and returns you the first finded

sugar.node.fs.folderPath.name: folderPath

This function returns you the folder path of the file path passed.
You can tell the function to check for file existence before getting
the folder path with the second parameter.

sugar.node.fs.folderSize.name: folderSize
sugar.node.fs.folderSize.description: Calculate the size of the passed folder and return it through a promise, either in raw format, either in human readdable one...

sugar.node.fs.formatFileSize.name: formatFileSize
sugar.node.fs.formatFileSize.description:
Transform into human readable string a file size from a number (float or integer) or string.
This function use the wonderfull "filesize" npm package under the houd.

sugar.node.fs.isPath.name: isPath
sugar.node.fs.isPath.description: Check if the passed string is a valid path or not

sugar.node.fs.move.name: move
sugar.node.fs.move.description: Moves a file or directory, even across devices (async)

sugar.node.fs.moveSync.name: moveSync
sugar.node.fs.moveSync.description: Moves a file or directory, even across devices (sync)

sugar.node.fs.remove.name: remove
sugar.node.fs.remove.description: Removes a file or directory. The directory can have contents. If the path does not exist, silently does nothing. Like rm -rf (async)

sugar.node.fs.removeSync.name: removeSync
sugar.node.fs.removeSync.description: Removes a file or directory. The directory can have contents. If the path does not exist, silently does nothing. Like rm -rf (sync)

sugar.node.fs.SFile.name: SFile
sugar.node.fs.SFile.description:
This class represent a file in the filesystem. With it you can simply instanciate one by passing the file path,
and get access to all the nice meta data like:
- name: The file name
- path: The full path to the file
- cwd: The root directory specified through the settings.cwd property
- relPath: The relative file path from the cwd
- dirPath: The path to the folder where is the file
- extension: The file extension
- size: The file size in megabytes
- bytes: The file siz in bytes
- exists:Bytestrue if the file exists on the disk, false otherwise

path.name: path
path.description:
Store the full file path
Some tokens can be used in the file path like:
- %tmpDir: return the absolute tmp package directory path
- %localDir: return the absolute .local package directory path
- %cacheDir: return the absolute cache package directory path
- %rootDir: return the absolute package root directory path
- %srcDir: return the absolute source package directory path
- %distDir: return the absolute dist package directory path

cwd.name: cwd
cwd.description:
Store the root directory where the file actually lives.
The root directory can be for example ```src/js``` for a file that lives under ```/my/cool/path/src/js/array/sort.js```.
To set this property, you need to pass the ```cwd``` setting through the constructor...

exists.name: exists
exists.description: Specify if the file exists on the filesystem or not

relPath.name: relPath
relPath.description:
Store the path relative to the ```cwd``` property. To have access to this property, you MUST
specify the settings.cwd through the constructor

dirPath.name: dirPath
dirPath.description: Store the path to the folder where the file lives

fileSettings.name: fileSettings
fileSettings.description: Access the file settings setted in the ```settings.file``` property

stats.name: stats
stats.description: Access the file stats like the updated timestamp, sizes, etc...

toObject.name: toObject
toObject.description: This method transform this instance into a plain object

startWatch.name: startWatch
startWatch.description: This method allows you to start watching the file for events like "update", etc...

stopWatch.name: stopWatch
stopWatch.description: This method allows you to stop the watching process of the file

toString.name: toString
toString.description: Return the string version of the file. Here, the path...

read.name: read
read.description: This method allows you to read the file asycronously

readSync.name: readSync
readSync.description: This method allows you to read the file syncronously

write.name: write
write.description: This method allows you to write the file asycronously

writeSync.name: writeSync
writeSync.description: This method allows you to write the file sycronously

sugar.node.fs.watch.name: watch
sugar.node.fs.watch.description:
This function wrap the "chokidar" awesome library into an SPromise based "api" with some
cool features like getting back an SFile instance for each files updated, etc...

sugar.node.fs.writeFile.name: writeFile
sugar.node.fs.writeFile.description: CWrite a file. If don't exist, will be created as well as the directory structure if needed... ( (async)

sugar.node.fs.writeFileSync.name: writeFileSync
sugar.node.fs.writeFileSync.description: Write a file. If don't exist, will be created as well as the directory structure if needed... (sync)

sugar.node.fs.writeJson.name: writeJson
sugar.node.fs.writeJson.description: Write a JSON file. If don't exist, will be created as well as the directory structure if needed... ( (async)

sugar.node.fs.writeJsonSync.name: writeJsonSync

This class represent a glob pattern and can be used to resolve some globs and get back
an array of SFile instances or to extract some part of the pattern, etc...

extractNoneGlob.description: Alias to the ```extractNoneGlob``` function available under "node/glob/extractNoneGlob"

sugar.node.init.initEnv.name: initEnv
sugar.node.init.initEnv.description:
This function "simply" init some environment variables that can be useful.
Here's the list of added environment variables available:

- PACKAGE_ROOT (null) {String}: Hold the filsystem package root path

sugar.node.ipc.SIpcClient.name: SIpcClient

This script check if a global ipc server exists aulready and if it is not the case,
it will start one that you can use to communicate between your child process, etc...

connectToParent.name: connectToParent

This static function allows you to connect to the parent process
if their's one.

hasParentServer.name: hasParentServer

connect.name: connect

sugar.node.ipc.SIpc.name: SIpc

This script check if a global ipc server exists aulready and if it is not the case,
it will start one that you can use to communicate between your child process, etc...

connexionParams.name: connexionParams

This method simply create a global server instance and returns it

stop.name: stop

sugar.node.is.childProcess.name: childProcess

sugar.node.is.directory.description: This function check if the passed string path is a directory or not

sugar.node.is.path.name: path
sugar.node.is.path.description: Check if the passed string is a valid path or not

sugar.node.is.symlink.name: symlink
sugar.node.is.symlink.description: This function check if the passed string path is a sySlink or not

SJsFileSettingsInterface.name: SJsFileSettingsInterface
SJsFileSettingsInterface.description: The interface describing the jsFile settings

SJsFileCtorSettingsInterface.name: SJsFileCtorSettingsInterface

sugar.node.npm.SNpmBinProcess.name: SNpmBinProcess

sugar.node.path.packageRoot.name: packageRoot

This function take as input either a string or an array of string and transform the pathes to relative

of command line process

This function allows you to spawn a new child process just like the native ```spawn``` node function

sugar.node.process.SProcess.description:
This class represent an SProcess run iteration that store things like
the value, the startTime, endTime, duration, state, etc...

This array store each executions informations in separated objects
that store the duration, startTime, endTime, state, etc...

Store the parameters interface to apply on the params object and on the initialParams object.

process.name: process
process.description:
This is the method you have to implement in you SProcess class. It will be called
when you call the ```run``` method with the params, etc...
You have to return an SPromise instance in order that the SProcess class is able to keep

This method is meant to be overrided by the subclass

Your ```run``` method has to call this one at the end and pass it an SPromise instance that represent your process.

- Aggregate all the wanted modules registered through the ```sugar-app.config.js``` file
- Instantiate all the modules like frontend server, build scss, etc...
- Configure the frontend server to serve all the needed files like js or css ones, etc...

sugar.node.template.engines.STemplateEng.name: STemplateEngine
sugar.node.template.engines.STemplateEng.description:
This class represent the base for a compatible ```STemplate``` engine
A template engine class MUST have some basic methods like:
- ```input```: A simple static property that tells if your template engine work with a "path" as input, or with a "string" (templateString) either...
- ```canRender```: A simple static method that take the template string as parameter and must return true if it can handle it and false if not
- ```render```: The main method that take as parameter either the view path to render, either directly the template string depending on his exposed static property ```input``` that can be either ```path``` or ```string``` as well as a data object to use for rendering process
-

sugar.scss.helper.function.is.name: is
sugar.scss.helper.function.is.description:
Check if the passed value is of a certain type

Here's the available types that you can check
- mixed => mean anything
- null
- url
- px
- pt
- rem
- em
- percent |%
- vw
- vh
- ex
- ch
- cm
- mm
- in
- pc
- s |second
- boolean |bool
- function
- number
- int |integer
- string
- color
- list
- map
- deg |degree
- list-{type} => check if is a list of the specified type
- map-{type} => check if is a map of the specified type

sugar.scss.responsive.mixin.init-body-me.name: init-body-media-queries
sugar.scss.responsive.mixin.init-body-me.description:
This mixin apply on the body all the media queries defines in the @config.media.queries configuration.
This mixin apply an animation that do nothing but will dispatch the animationEnd event catchable by javascript
So it will be easy to use the "mediaQuery" function that you can find in the "@coffeekraken/sugar/js/responsive/mediaQuery"
namespace.

sugar.scss.responsive.mixin.mediaQuery.name: mediaQuery
sugar.scss.responsive.mixin.mediaQuery.description:
This mixin allows you to specify easily which media (defined in the media.config.js file) has to be targeted.
You can specify multiple medias if needed and specify how you want to target the specific media.
Check out the examples for more info.
By default, the Sugar toolkit offer these medias to be targeted:
- mobile
- mobile-portrait
- mobile-landscape
- tablet
- tablet-portrait
- tablet-landscape
- desktop

You can use some "actions" to specify your target. The available actions are:
- '>': Greater than...
- '<': Lower than...
- '=': Equal...
- '>=': Greater or equal...
- '>=': Lower or equal...

Your media queries can be something like this: '<tablet', '>mobile <desktop', '=tablet-landscape'.
If you don't specicy any action in your queries, by default the "defaultAction" property in the media.config.js file will
be applied and this default action is setted to ">=". This is setted like this to work in "mobile first" schema by default.
